revised_title: Effects of a Thunderstorm and Lightning on a Farmhouse and House in Cornwall
tldr: A thunderstorm and lightning struck a farmhouse and a house in Cornwall, causing significant damage to both structures. The lightning entered the farmhouse through the windows and tore through walls, ceilings, and floors, leaving a smoky residue and a sulphurous smell. It also affected trees nearby, leaving furrows in the bark and the ground. In another house, lightning struck the chimney, melted metal objects, and injured two women and a man. The lightning's power and speed were remarkable, leaving a lasting impression on those who experienced it.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Natural Disasters
